newsitem.title: USA: IBM names Mitsubishi president to board.
newsitem.headline: IBM names Mitsubishi president to board.

text.p: International Business Machines Corp. said Tuesday it has expanded the size of its board of directors to 12 members, electing Mitsubishi Corp. President Minoru Makihara to fill the new spot.

"Makihara-san is a truly global executive who not only heads one of Japan's most important companies, but also has broad experience and understanding of the global economy and major markets of the world," IBM Chairman Louis Gerstner said in a statement. "I have known him for many years. His experience and interests are broad and he will be a very valuable addition to the IBM board."

Makihara, 67, has been president of Mitsubishi, which is headquartered in Tokyo, since 1992. The last time IBM added a board member was in 1995, when Lucio Noto, the chairman and chief executive of Mobile Corp. joined IBM as a director.
Separately, IBM also announced a regular dividend of 20 cents a share, payable Sept. 10, to shareholders of record as of Aug. 11.
